Vincent van Gogh, the Dutch master who created the first abstract paintings in 17 years, died in Gothenburg on December 28, 2019, at age eighty-seven.The Dutch Academy of Arts (Dean) in Amsterdam confirmed the artist’s passing, but said that van Gogh “gave his life to teaching and to painting in order to reach something of the very essence of everyday life.” The museum also said that van Gogh’s work history is rich and that it will be a “moment of remembrance and exploration.”
